intro: Xantho glabrata, commonly known as the smooth yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are smooth and often lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branching. Xantho glabrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
